predicate.note: Frames file for 'banish' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 10.2.

roleset.name: send away, expel

example.name: transitive
example.text: The whole idea of computer-integrated manufacturing, CIM, seems to be making a comeback after losing a little luster over the past couple of years when it became apparent that it wasn't a panacea that [*T*-1] would make U.S. plants more efficient and banish foreign competition.

example.name: passive
example.text: Meanwhile, they tackle the mounds of paper -- and fantasize about a dream world where bulk-mail postal regulations and government inspectors are banished [*-1].
example.arg: [*-1] -> bulk-mail postal regulations and government inspectors

example.name: all args
example.text: Mary banished John from her bedroom forever.

roleset.note: I have an intuition about a destination arg also; "banish to the hinterlands".
